meanings.definition: To make something common to all members of a group.
meanings.sent1: In our class, we communises the snacks by sharing them equally.
meanings.sent2: The teacher communises the toys so that everyone gets a turn to play.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake communises joy among the children at the party.
meanings.sent4: Kindness communises warmth in the hearts of those who receive it.
meanings.sent5: The sun communises light to brighten up the entire room.

meanings.definition: To establish a system of government in which the means of production are owned and controlled by the community as a whole.
meanings.sent1: The community communises the farmland to ensure fair distribution of crops.
meanings.sent2: The government communises the factories to benefit all workers equally.
meanings.sent3: The idea of communising the ice cream truck made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Communising resources is like creating a big family where everyone shares.
meanings.sent5: The decision to communise resources sparked a sense of unity among the people.
